    • Method Detail

      • abortDelivery

        public void abortDelivery()
                   throws EnablerException
        Allows transactions to be aborted for some pump types

        Note : Not supported by all pump drivers.

        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

      • addPumpEventListener

        public void addPumpEventListener(Pump.PumpEventListener ev)
        Adds an event listener to the list of registered event listeners for the Pump class
        See Also:
        Pump.PumpEventListener

      • authoriseNoLimits

        public void authoriseNoLimits(java.lang.String clientActivity,
                     java.lang.String clientRef,
                     int attendantId)
                       throws EnablerException
        Authorise the pump with no limits
        Parameters:
        clientActivity - An optional string to indicate an activity or whatever the client application wants to store against a transaction.
        clientRef - Client reference string(optional)

        Note : This must match any previous Reserve. The Client reference will be recorded against the transaction. The Transaction can then be looked up using the Client reference.

        attendantId - Id of the attendant authorising this transaction or -1 if there is no attendant
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.
        See Also:
        Pump.authoriseWithLimits method, Pump.cancelAuthorise method

      • authoriseWithLimits

        public void authoriseWithLimits(java.lang.String clientActivity,
                       java.lang.String clientRef,
                       int attendantId,
                       PumpAuthoriseLimits limits)
                         throws EnablerException
        Authorise a pump with limitations.
        Parameters:
        clientActivity - An optional string to indicate an activity or whatever the client application wants to store against a transaction.
        clientRef - Client reference string(optional)

        Note : This must match any previous Reserve. The Client reference will be recorded against the transaction. The Transaction can then be looked up using the Client reference.

        attendantId - Id of the attendant authorising this transaction or -1 if there is no attendant
        limits - Limits that apply to this authorisation. See PumpAuthoriseLimits for more information.
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.
        See Also:
        Pump.authoriseWithoutLimits method, Pump.cancelAuthorise method

        public void cancelAuthorise()
                     throws EnablerException
        Cancel the authorisation from a pump, this can only be done before a delivery starts

      • getCurrentHose

        public Hose getCurrentHose()
        Returns:
        A reference to the hose object currently lifted from the pump when it is CALLING or DELIVERING.

        Note : Returns null if no hose is out.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the price level configured for the pump
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If an invalid price level argument is passed.

      • pauseDelivery

        public void pauseDelivery()
                   throws EnablerException
        Pause a delivering pump
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

      • removeEventListener

        public void removeEventListener(Pump.PumpEventListener ev)
        Removes an event listener from the list of registered event listeners for the Pump class.

        Call this method whenever disposing object references in your application having links to this pump. It is highly recommended to call this method otherwise event listeners may still be registered, references maintained and will NOT be garbadge collected.

        Parameters:
        ev - the Pump Event Listener to be removed

      • reserve

        public void reserve(java.lang.String clientActivity,
           java.lang.String clientReference,
           java.lang.Boolean clearIfZero)
             throws EnablerException
        Reserve the Pump for this terminal
        Parameters:
        clientActivity - String value for the use of the client application - to indicate the fuelling activity type.
        clientReference - String value for the use of the client application - a transaction reference or audit.
        clearIfZero - True if Enabler should clear zero transactions automatically.
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

      • reserve

        public void reserve(java.lang.String clientActivity,
           java.lang.String clientReference,
           java.lang.Boolean clearIfZero,
           ReservedType reservedType)
             throws EnablerException
        Reserve the Pump for this terminal with legacy type
        Parameters:
        clientActivity - String value for the use of the client application - to indicate the fuelling activity type.
        clientReference - String value for the use of the client application - a transaction reference or audit.
        clearIfZero - True if Enabler should clear zero transactions automatically.
        reservedType - Indicates the legacy reserve type.
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

      • resumeDelivery

        public void resumeDelivery()
                    throws EnablerException
        Remove pause on a pump
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

      • setBlock

        public void setBlock(boolean blockState,
            java.lang.String reasonMessage)
              throws EnablerException
        Block/Unblock all operations on the pump.
        Blocking a Pump will prevent it from starting a new Transaction. If a pump is blocked the isBlocked method will return true. The unblock will clear an outstanding manual block or any block set from a Pump stop or a Forecourt stop.
        Parameters:
        blockState - Set to true to block pump, false to unblock.
        reasonMessage - Optional message for block reason to be logged into the journal.
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

      • setDisplayText

        public void setDisplayText(java.lang.String text)
                    throws EnablerException
        Sets the Display Text property which is shared between all clients and displayed on the Pump Control icon
        Parameters:
        text -
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

        public void setPriceLevelMapping(int level,
                        int mapLevel)
                          throws EnablerException
        Sets the price mapping for a price level.
        Parameters:
        level - The level to change.
        mapLevel - New level to map to for price level.
        Throws:
        EnablerException

      • setPumpLightsOn

        public void setPumpLightsOn(java.lang.Boolean pumpLights)
                     throws EnablerException
        Sets the new state of the pump lights
        Parameters:
        pumpLights - True to activate pump lighting (if supported)
        False to deactivate the pump lighting
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

      • stackCurrentTransaction

        public void stackCurrentTransaction()
                             throws EnablerException
        Stack current transaction so that the pump can be reserved or authorised again.
        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

      • stop

        public void stop()
          throws EnablerException

        Permanently stop an in progress delivery.

        The pump is also blocked after this call, so the client application must unblock the pump before another delivery may begin.

        Throws:
        EnablerException - if the operation fails.

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Pump name and number
